intro: Conostegia dolichostylis, commonly known as the long-styled conostegia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Conostegia dolichostylis plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly hummingbirds and bees.
